div.ab: To Herodes, also called Tiberius, strategus of the Arsinoite, Themistes division, from Sarapous, daughter of The......... from the village of Theadelphia. .... in deed and manner .........................appointed by your excellency(?) .............. using rude willfulness and effrontery every time he attacks me and in my own house directs unspeakable insults against me, not only verbally, but also with blows. For this reason, since I have for a long time not been able to lead a peaceful life and am in danger every day, I turn to you in my weakness and helplessness, and I request that he may be brought before you to be appropriately punished, so that I through your help and assistance may live in complete peace in my home and may obtain redress. Farewell. ;In the twelfth year of the emperor Caesar Traianus Hadrianus Augustus, Hathyr 7
